value.title: Building a Virtual Relationship in Power BI   Basics of TREATAS DAX Function
value.excerpt: TreatAs is an interesting function with multiple use cases in Power BI. I thought it is good to explain it in a set of videos, the first one here is about what the TreatAs function is and how it can help to build filters and a virtual relationship between two tables. Let's see how you can use this function.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/YCJjeD8wz5c" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Creating a Table in Power BI Using DAX Table Constructor
value.excerpt: There are some functions in DAX that are useful in very specific scenarios. For example, sometimes, you might want to create a table entirely in DAX. If you want to do that, what are your ways and how it is possible? This might be helpful especially in the first days of learning about DAX. Let's see
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/E7FeT713H8Y" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. Read my blog
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hJJnyr1qxtk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Write Conditional Statement Using SWITCH in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: Conditional expressions are one of the most commonly used expressions in any language as well as DAX. However, in DAX, if you have multiple IF THEN expressions, there is an easier way of doing it; using a function called SWITCH, this video is about how you can use switch function in DAX and Power BI
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fOErC7eaWZ0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to debug a DAX measure
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to run and debug a DAX measure: fix a calculation issue in a more productive environment and then copy the right formula back in Power BI. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ VertiPaq Analyzer: https://www.sqlbi.com/tools/vertipaq-analyzer/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fU5EQBJDfOM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Using CONCATENATEX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video showcases the use of CONCATENATEX, a handy DAX function to return a list of values in a measure. Article and download: https://sql.bi/206871
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/6gCk4UoOw0g" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX
value.excerpt: Time intelligence functions oftentimes hide an automatic ALL statement meant to make time intelligence calculations easier. This video describes this behavior and what to do in case it ends up breaking your calculation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/123591
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JS-K2faCiCc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

value.title: How to Use CALCULATE in Power BI
value.excerpt: This is one of the most import function to master in Power BI. You can filter your data and create complex measure such as year over year comparisons with ease with these easy to follow tutorial. More more help this function.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #11: Using variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables are an extremely useful feature in DAX, but perhaps not a well known one. Variables, 1. Make your formulas more readable 2. You can reuse them through your report 3. Can also be tables 4. Are more efficient  Download our Growth dashboard if you want to see the example live:http://curbal.com/blog/the-ultimate-dashboard-to-track-your-website-growth-with-google-analytics-and-power-bi-supercharged-excel
